newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: PRESS DIGEST - Sri Lanka Newspapers - May 8.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Sri Lanka Newspapers - May 8.

text.p: These are the leading stories in the Sri Lankan press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
Tight security in Male, the capital of Maldives, for the SAARC (South Asian Association for Regional Coorperation) heads of state summit on May 12.
An Airlanka Lockheed Tristar suffers damage to tail during take-off at Colombo airport on Sunday, aviation sources say. But aircraft proceeded to its destination in Saudi Arabia.
Sri Lanka plans to form alliance with Malaysia and other natural rubber producing countries to counter competition posed by synthetic rubber, Trade Minister Kingsley Wickramaratne says.

At least 11 industries will have to close down today if six-day old strike at Shell Gas Lanka, Sri Lanka's monopoly gas distributor, continues, industrialists tell Labour Minister Mahinda Rajapakse, who is involved in negotiations to settle strike.
Police uncover plot by Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam (LTTE) rebels to deploy suicide bombers to stage attacks in Colombo while disguised as military and police officers.
Many restaurants and food outlets closed due to non-availability of gas as strike at gas company enters sixth day. Households too badly affected.
Night mail train from eastern Polonnaruwa to Colombo derailed after it hits a wild elephant, on Monday. The elephant died after being dragged by train for about 300 metres, railway authorities say.
